attributes.action: Condemn the government of Uganda if they pass the ‘Anti-Homosexuality Bill’ which proposes the death penalty for some homosexual activities
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
A draft of the “Anti-Homosexuality Bill”  was introduced by Ndorwa West MP, David Bahati on October 14, 2009 providing for a death penalty for those engaging in homosexuality.

Homosexuality is already a crime in Uganda (introduced into the penal code by the british), but the Minister of Ethics and Integrity, Dr. James Nsaba Buturo has been complaining that the law is inadequate to curb homosexuality that is reported to be on the increase in Uganda.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "Condemn the government of Uganda if they pass the ‘Anti-Homosexuality Bill’ which proposes the death penalty for some homosexual activities."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number10.gov.uk/Page22513


Prime Minister's Office
